channel.title: RE-ENTER technical and information blog
channel.description: Contains important information and experiments from RE-ENTER SAS employees. Find here articles about Docker, Chef, Oracle Commerce and all the software and tools we use daily at RE-ENTER

item.title: Oracle Commerce Go Live Checklist
item.description: Custom property descriptors can be used to implement specific logic in Oracle Commerce. If you do not write them correctly, they will be executed continuously for each repository query.

item.title: Oracle Commerce 11 Silent Installation
item.description: This article explains how to prepare a silent installation file and install silently Oracle Commerce 11

item.title: Endeca Proactive Load Balancing
item.description: When load balancing Endeca, you need to do proactive load balancing in order to serve all search engine requests even during the index switch of a baseline update

item.title: Endeca MDEX Load Balancing
item.description: We will talk about how to simulate load on endeca and test the dgraph availability during baseline updates in this article. The idea is to load balance search queries on several Mdexes. For that, we will use HA Proxy as a load balancer between two MDEX engines.

item.title: Assembling ATG Commerce Reference Store For Preview
item.description: How to assemble a standalone EAR for Oracle ATG Commerce Reference Store with Endeca preview

item.title: Introduction to Ansible
item.description: Introduction on how to configure servers with Ansible

item.title: Using HarpJS for a company website
item.description: Why Harp JS is well suited for simple and small company websites

item.title: Dockerizing Oracle Commerce
item.description: Article on how to Dockerize an Oracle Commerce application (formerly know as ATG). I made my experiments using JBOSS EAP in an Ubuntu based container. The process would speed up integration tasks. Docker can be used in production at your own risk.

item.title: Oracle Commerce Guided Search Tools and Framework response file
item.description: A short explanation on how to install Oracle Commerce Guided Search Workbench silently on Unix systems without having to install a X11 server

item.title: Installing Oracle Commerce 11.1
item.description: Notes on how to install Commerce Reference Store 11.1 with the Oracle Commerce Guided Search wired on. The CRS relies heavily on the new Oracle Experience Manager contents and can no longer start without that.

item.title: ATG dyn/admin chrome plugin
item.description: I wrote a chrome plugin for ATG web admin console and here is the desciption of its features
